00039 /**
00040  * @file commbuffer.h
00041  * @date 2008/05/25 16:20
00042  * @author Sergio Montenegro, Lutz Dittrich
00043  *
00044  * Copyright 2008 DLR
00045  *
00046  * @brief simple buffer for asynchronous communication (header)
00047  */
00048 
00049 #pragma once
00050 
00051 #include "putter.h"
00052 
00053 
00054 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00055 namespace RODOS {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 /**
00059  * @class CommBuffer
00060  * @brief A simple buffer for asynchronous communication
00061  *
00062  * CommBuffer can be used to interchange data asynchronously.
00063  * both sides (reader/writer) can work simultaneously and the data
00064  * will be allways consistent.
00065  * There can be only one reader and only one writer.
00066  * Eachtime the reader reads, it gets the latest data written.
00067  * Due to fast switching between the buffers, the delay in simultaneous access
00068  * is only short.
00069  * @param Type Type of the data to synchonize by CommBuffer
00070  */
00071 
00072 template <typename Type> class CommBuffer : public Putter {
00073 
00074 private:
00075     /// Data area consisting of three independent parts to avoid access conflicts.
00076     Type buffer[3];
00077     /// Pointer to buffer area that is currently written or will be written next.
00078     Type* writer;
00079     /// Pointer to buffer where last data is stored.
00080     Type* reader;
00081     /// Additional buffer, to avaoid conflicts between simultaneous read-write access.
00082     Type* intermediate;
00083     /** Flag to protect buffer. It indicates access to the current read buffer 
00084      * in order to prevent data conflicts.
00085      */
00086     volatile bool readingNow;
00087 
00088 public:
00089   uint64_t writeCnt;
00090   uint64_t readCnt;
00091   /** Constructor */
00092   CommBuffer() {
00093     writer = &buffer[0];
00094     reader = &buffer[1];
00095     intermediate = &buffer[2];
00096     readingNow = false;
00097     writeCnt = readCnt = 0;
00098   }
00099 
00100   /**
00101    * Implements the generic interface of class Putter.
00102    * Put methods should only used by one thread.
00103    * @param msgLen Length of the message.
00104    * @param data Pointer to the message data to put.
00105    * @return true if the put operation is successful, else false. If the
00106    * msgLen doesn't match the size of the template type the method is never
00107    * successful.
00108    */
00109   bool putGeneric(const long topicId, const unsigned int len, const void* msg, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo) {
00110     if(len > sizeof(Type)) {
00111       ERROR("combuffer wrong len");
00112       return false;
00113     }
00114     put(*(Type*)msg);
00115     return true;
00116   }
00117 
00118   /**
00119    * Implements the the put operation of data to the CommBuffer. The data is
00120    * stored in the buffer, and swap read and write buffer for next write.
00121    * Put methods should only used by one thread.
00122    * @param data Reference of the message data to put.
00123    */
00124   void put(Type& data) {
00125     *writer = data;
00126 
00127     /* Swap reader <-> writer in order to make them read in the next call to get. */
00128     Type* swap = reader;
00129     reader = writer;
00130     writer = swap;
00131 
00132     /* Buffer being read now? Then take the intermediate buffer for the next write. */
00133     if(readingNow) {
00134       swap = writer;
00135       writer = intermediate;
00136       intermediate = swap;
00137     }
00138     writeCnt++;
00139   }
00140 
00141   /**
00142    * Get the next consistent message from the CommBuffer.
00143    * The method get should only used by one thread.
00144    * @param data Reference of the message data to get.
00145    */
00146   void get(Type &data) {
00147     readingNow = true;
00148     Type* readerTmp = reader; // This is assumed to be atomar
00149     data = *readerTmp;            // this is not atomar
00150     readingNow = false;
00151     readCnt++;
00152   }
00153  
00154  /** like get, but modifiy out parameter only if there is new data **/
00155 
00156   bool getOnlyIfNewData(Type &data) {
00157     if(writeCnt > readCnt) {
00158        get(data);
00159        readCnt = writeCnt;
00160        return true;
00161     }
00162     return false;
00163   }
00164 };
00165 
00166 
00167 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00168 }
00169 #endif
